zc.thread
Class CondVar

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.CondVar
Direct Known Subclasses:
Latch
public class CondVar
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a simple "condition variable." The notion is that a thread awaits for some condition to become true. If the condition is false, then no wait occurs.

Be very careful of nested-monitor-lockout here: 

  class lockout {
      CondVar theCondVar = new CondVar();
      void synchronized foo() throws InterruptedException {
          // nested monitor here
          theCondVar.await();
      }
      void synchronized bar() {
          theCondVar.set();
      }
  }

  final lockout theLockout = new lockout();

  Thread racer1 = new Thread("racer1") {
      public void run() {
          try {
              theLockout.foo();
          }
          catch(Exception ex) {
              fail(ex.getMessage());
          }
      }
  };

  racer1.start();

  // Deadlock because the Thread "racer1" hold the lockout's monitor !
  theLockout.bar();
The solution is either to release the lockout's monitor before waiting on the CondVar: 
      void foo() throws InterruptedException {
          synchronized(this) {
              // some code...
          }
          // Moved theCondVar.await() outside the monitor
          theCondVar.await();
      }
or to not synchronizing the Lockout.bar() function. 
      // Removed the synchronized statement
      void bar() {
          theCondVar.set();
      }

await

public void await()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait (potentially forever) for the condition to turns true. If the condition is already true, then no wait occurs.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.

await

public boolean await(long msecs)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait at most msecs milliseconds for the condition to turns true.
Parameters:
msecs - the number of milliseconds to wait before giving up.
Returns:
true if the condition became true within the given time.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.
